intro: Houstonia macrosepala, commonly known as the large-sepaled bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant produces small, delicate blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
